channel.title: The Times of India Sports: Extensive sports coverage, key statistics and free downloads
channel.description: The Times of India Sports gives you latest sports coverage, scores and milestones; covers all sporting events, provides key statistics and free downloads

image.title: The Times of India Sports: Extensive sports coverage, key statistics and free downloads

item.title: Indo-Pak Express kicks up desert storm
item.description: By winning the Dubai ATP 500 Series tournament, Rohan Bopanna and Aisam-ul-Haq Qureshi showed once again why the Indo-Pak Express is on track.

item.title: Federer downs Berdych for Dubai crown
item.description: Rising to the wave of the 'Roger, Roger, Roger' chants of the crowd, Federer rallied to defeat Tomas Berdych 3-6, 6-4, 6-3 to clinch his sixth crown in Dubai.

item.title: Yuvraj Singh towers over Delhi at Kotla
item.description: A magnificent 96* by Yuvraj Singh helped Punjab beat Delhi by six wickets in their second match of the Vijay Hazare Trophy at the Ferozeshah Kotla on Saturday.

item.title: India lacks quality spinners: Harbhajan
item.description: Harbhajan said there was lack of quality spinners in the domestic circuit adding it was good for a spinner to have variations but one should stick to the basics.

item.title: Walters puts dent in Arsenal's title bid
item.description: Arsenal's Premier League title challenge suffered major blow as they crashed to a shock 1-0 defeat at Stoke following Jon Walters' late penalty on Saturday.

item.title: Fedex beats Berdych to claim Dubai title
item.description: World number 8 Roger Federer won his sixth Dubai Open title on Saturday with a 3-6, 6-4, 6-3 victory over Tomas Berdych of the Czech Republic in Dubai.

item.title: Bopanna, Qureshi win Dubai Open title
item.description: Rohan Bopanna and Aisam-ul-Haq Qureshi won their first ATP title after re-union as they beat Daniel Nestor and Nenad Zimonjic in Dubai Open doubles final.

item.title: Afghanistan stun Bangladesh by 32 runs
item.description: Brilliant show by Asghar Stanikzai (90*) and Samiullah Shenwari (81) followed by some spirited bowling saw Afghanistan beat Bangladesh in their Asia Cup tie.

item.title: South Africa colts lift ICC U19 World Cup
item.description: Aiden Markram (66) helped South Africa lift the ICC under-19 World Cup defeating Pakistan by six wickets in a low-scoring final encounter on Saturday.

item.title: Afghanistan fight back with quick wkts
item.description: Bangladesh seemed to lose the plot in their 255-run chase as Afghanistan picked up regular wickets at regular intervals in their Asia Cup match in Fatullah.

item.title: Afghanistan fight back as Mominul falls
item.description: Mominul Haque's courageous innings came to an end as spinner Samiullah Shenwari got the better of his stumps in their Asia Cup tie in Fatullah on Saturday.

item.title: Yuvraj Singh fashions Punjab's victory
item.description: Yuvraj Singh showed requisite patience before exploding as his sparkling unbeaten 96 scripted Punjab's 6-wkt win over Delhi in Vijay Hazare Trophy.

item.title: Afghanistan set 255-run target for B'desh
item.description: Asghar Stanikzai and Samiullah Shenwari put up a solid 164-run partnership to lead Afghanistan to 254/6 against Bangladesh in their Asia Cup tie in Fatullah.

item.title: Stanikzai, Shenwari steady Afghanistan
item.description: Asghar Stanikzai and Samiullah Shenwari shared an unbeaten 100-run stand to lead Afghanistan recovery against Bangladesh in Asia Cup match in Fatullah.

item.title: Bangladesh on top against Afghanistan
item.description: Afghanistan struggled in their innings as they lost wickets at regular intervals against Bangladesh in Asia Cup match at Khan Shaheb Osman Ali Stadium.

item.title: Sunny's double strike rocks Afghanistan
item.description: Afghanistan struggled early in their innings as they lost three quick wickets against Bangladesh in Asia Cup match at Khan Shaheb Osman Ali Stadium, Fatullah.

item.title: India need to make amends against Pak
item.description: India will look to regroup quickly and plug their loopholes as they go into the make or break match against arch-rivals Pakistan in Asia Cup on Sunday.

item.title: Afghanistan lose Mohd Shahzad early
item.description: Bangladesh pacer Rubel Hossain struck early to give Afghanistan first blow as he dismissed opener Mohammad Shahzad in Asia Cup match in Fatullah.

item.title: Afghanistan lose Mohd Shahzad early
item.description: Bangladesh pacer Rubel Hossain struck early to give Afghanistan first blow as he dismissed opener Mohammad Shahzad in Asia Cup match in Fatullah on Saturday

item.title: Bangladesh elect to bowl vs Afghanistan
item.description: Bangladesh skipper Mushfiqur Rahim won the toss and decided to field against Afghanistan in their must-win Asia Cup match in Fatullah on Saturday.

item.title: Federer out of Bhupathi-linked IPTL
item.description: Federer reportedly joined Maria Sharapova and Li Na in opting out of International Premier Tennis League (IPTL), which has been modelled on the lines of IPL.

item.title: Mohd Shahzad wants to emulate Dhoni
item.description: The helicopter shot is not the only thing Afghanistan's Shahzad has in common with Dhoni. Both are keeper-batsman, they share the same initials 'MS'.

item.title: KP takes swipe at 'big cheese' Matt Prior
item.description: Kevin Pietersen responded by lashing out at wicket-keeper Matt Prior as the controversial batsman labelled his former England team-mate a 'big cheese'.

item.title: Flowing Federer floors Djokovic in Dubai
item.description: Roger Federer defeated the top-seeded Serb Novak Djokovic 3-6, 6-3, 6-2 in a match in which the Swiss superstar's genius overshadowed his opponent's guts.

item.title: Top stars line-up for Bhupathi's IPTL
item.description: Some of the biggest names in tennis have signed-up for Mahesh Bhupathi's International Premier Tennis League which will have its player draft on Sunday.
